sentence: Estee Lauder Companies, Inc. ( EL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on May 29, 2013.
A cash dividend payment of $0.18 per share is scheduled to be paid on June 17, 2013.
Shareholders who purchased EL stock prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
At the current stock price of $70.95, the dividend yield is 1.01%.
The previous trading day's last sale of EL was $70.95, representing a -1.88% decrease from the 52 week high of $72.31 and a 42.44% increase over the 52 week low of $49.81.
EL is a part of the Consumer Non-Durables sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
EL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.47.
Zacks Investment Research reports EL's forecasted earnings growth in 2013 as 15.24%, compared to an industry average of -2.9%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the EL Dividend History page.
Interested in gaining exposure to EL through an Exchange Traded Fund [ETF]?

The following ETF(s) have EL as a top-10 holding:

The top-performing ETF of this group is PSL with an increase of 17.01% over the last 100 days.
It also has the highest percent weighting of EL at 2.5%.
